condition.description:
Scarlet fever is a condition caused by the same bacteria that causes strep throat, called Group A Streptococcus. Scarlet fever usually occurs in children after they've come down with strep throat. Symptoms include

  • Fever
  • Sore throat
  • Rash that starts on the neck and chest and spreads outward to the body
  • Abdominal pain
  • Headache
  • Muscle aches
  • Swollen, red tongue

Doctors test for Scarlet fever by doing a throat swab and bacteria culture. It's treated with antibiotics, and most symptoms usually resolve quickly, though the rash might last for 2 to 3 weeks.
condition.name: Scarlet fever
symptoms: Rash that starts on the neck and chest and spreads outward to the body

carousel_items: Take this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
If you're taking birth control pills, this medication can make them less effective.
Try to take it on an empty stomach. If this gives you an upset stomach, take it with food.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.

basics.benefits_moa: Penicillin is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from making their own protective covering.
basics.bottom_line: Penicillin is good for treating many bacterial infections and is available as a generic. You may need to use another form of birth control along with your birth control pills. It's also best taken on an empty stomach but it can cause an upset stomach.
downsides: Many bacteria have developed resistance. Your doctor may run tests to see if Penicillin will work on your infection.
Can make birth control pills less effective.
Best taken on an empty stomach, but can cause stomach upset.

downsides_processed.orig: Many bacteria have developed resistance. Your doctor may run tests to see if Penicillin will work on your infection.
Can make birth control pills less effective.
Best taken on an empty stomach, but can cause stomach upset.

upsides: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule and suspension.
Used to treat many types of bacterial infections.

upsides_processed.orig: Available in different forms: tablet, capsule and suspension.

userStories.tip: I could tell immediately that it was working as my symptoms were clearing up and only 2 days later I was back to my normal healthy self. Fast forward to a few days after the full 10 day treatment (faithfully) and I had strep again. Welp.
Take every 12 hours to keep the bug fighting going. Rest up if you are tired from the infection you are fighting. Binge TV watching is a good companion for day 1 of therapy.
userStories.identifier: Fit guy in his forties-volleyball lover

drugs.name: Penicillin

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take this medication exactly how your doctor tells you to.
If you're taking birth control pills, this medication can make them less effective.
Try to take it on an empty stomach. If this gives you an upset stomach, take it with food.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Diarrhea
risks_warnings.description: As with all antibiotics, Penicillin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

description_processed.orig: As with all antibiotics, Penicillin can cause diarrhea. If this happens while you're taking the medication, taking probiotics in the form of yogurt, supplements or drinks a few hours after you take the medication may help. If you develop an unusual diarrhea with loose or bloody stools weeks after you finish the medication, talk to your doctor as this can be a rare but serious side effect.

risks_warnings.title: Decreased effectiveness of birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: If you are taking Penicillin and you are also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Penicillin.

description_processed.orig: If you are taking Penicillin and you are also on birth control pills, the birth control can become less effective. Consider using a barrier form of birth control (condoms, diaphragms, etc.) while taking Penicillin.

risks_warnings.title: Allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Penicillin has been known to cause allergic reactions including severe rash, trouble breathing, and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling or hives). Seek immediate medical attention.
risk_factors: Prior severe allergic reaction to Penicillin
